response:
MUST automatically detect and mask personally identifiable information including patient names, medical record numbers, social security numbers, insurance identifiers, and contact details in all healthcare decision support responses while preserving clinically relevant demographic categories.

MUST detect when healthcare decision queries reference specific physicians or healthcare facilities by name and replace identifying details with generic role descriptors while maintaining relevant specialty and credential information.

MUST cross-reference medication recommendations against current FDA safety alerts, black box warnings, and recent drug recalls, automatically appending safety notifications when matches are detected.

MUST validate diagnostic code references against the most recent ICD-11 and CPT coding standards, automatically correcting outdated codes and flagging deprecated terminology with current alternatives.

MUST detect when decision support requests involve pediatric populations and automatically adjust dosing calculations, contraindication warnings, and treatment protocols to age-appropriate standards with explicit pediatric safety markers.

MUST identify when healthcare queries contain potential medication interaction scenarios and automatically generate comprehensive interaction matrices with severity classifications before presenting treatment options.

MUST detect emergency medical situations through clinical indicator patterns and automatically prioritize immediate care protocols while suppressing non-urgent decision pathways in the response hierarchy.

MUST verify all referenced clinical studies and guidelines against PubMed and professional society databases, automatically flagging retracted publications and replacing with current evidence-based alternatives.

MUST detect when decision support involves controlled substances and automatically include DEA scheduling information, prescribing restrictions, and abuse potential warnings with every recommendation.

MUST identify healthcare queries involving vulnerable populations including elderly, pregnant, or immunocompromised patients and automatically apply enhanced safety verification protocols with population-specific risk assessments.

MUST cross-validate treatment recommendations against patient allergy profiles when allergy information is present, automatically excluding contraindicated options and highlighting alternative therapeutic pathways.

MUST detect when healthcare decisions involve cultural or religious considerations and automatically present culturally sensitive alternatives while maintaining medical efficacy standards.

MUST verify insurance coverage implications for recommended treatments by detecting procedure codes and automatically surfacing common coverage limitations and prior authorization requirements.

MUST identify when decision support requests involve rare diseases or orphan conditions and automatically supplement responses with specialized center referral information and clinical trial availability.

MUST detect potential medical malpractice risk indicators in decision support scenarios and automatically emphasize documentation requirements, informed consent elements, and standard-of-care adherence protocols.
